notes: Konecny wasn't on the ice with Team Canada for Monday's practice due to an illness, Jackie Spiegel of The Philadelphia Inquirer reports.
Forsling (illness) missed Team Sweden's practice Monday, Tom Gulitti of NHL.com reports.

Shesterkin is dealing with an upper-body injury that carries a recovery timetable of 1-2 weeks, according to Arthur Staple of The Athletic.
Demko did not return to Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against the Maple Leafs.

Lyubushkin did not play in Friday's (Feb. 7) game against the Kings.
Fabbro (concussion) should be ready to return after the 4 Nations Face-Off, according to Aaron Portzline of The Athletic on Monday.

The Evangelista listed Wilsby as OUT for Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against Buffalo.

Pelletier did not play in Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against Penguins.

Hughes did not play in Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against Maple Leafs.
Barzal had a procedure done on his kneecap Thursday (Feb. 6) and is expected to miss about six weeks, according to Pierre LeBrun of TSN.
The New York Rangers placed F Adam Edstrom on Injured Reserve Tuesday (Feb. 4).
The Utah Hockey Club placed F Logan Cooley on Injured Reserve on Tuesday (Feb. 4).
Johansson will not be available for the Lightning's next four contests, as per Eduardo A. Encina of the Tampa Bay Times reports Tuesday (Feb. 4).
Wennberg did not play in Thursday's (Feb. 6) game versus the Canucks.
The Los Angeles Kings placed D Mikey Anderson on injured reserve on Saturday (Feb. 8).
The San Jose Sharks placed F Nikolai Kovalenko on Injured Reserve on Thursday (Feb. 6).
Evans did not play in Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against Calgary.
The Winnipeg Jets placed F Morgan Barron on Injured Reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 29).
The Dallas Stars placed D Nils Lundkvist on Long Term Injured Reserve on Saturday (Feb. 1).
Tippett did not play in Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against Penguins.
The Canadiens announced Guhle sustained a lacerated quadricep muscle and was released from the hospital today and will be Out indefinitely.
Heiskanen is month to month after having knee surgery according to Mike Heika of DallasStars.com.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Kirill Kaprizov on Long Term Injured Reserve Sunday (Jan. 26).
The New Jersey Devils placed F Nico Hischier on Injured Reserve on Thursday. (Feb. 6)
The San Jose Sharks placed D Jan Rutta on Injured Reserve Sunday (Jan. 26).
The Calgary Flames placed D Kevin Bahl on Injured Reserve on Friday (Jan. 31).
The New York Islanders placed G Marcus Hogberg on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Evgeni Malkin on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
The New York Islanders placed D Ryan Pulock on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
Cousins is expected to miss the next 6-8 weeks, according to Bruce Garrioch of Postmedia.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Egor Zamula on Injured Reserve on Friday (Jan. 31).
The New York Islanders placed D Noah Dobson on Long Term Injured Reserve Sunday (Jan. 26).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F William Karlsson on Long-term Injured Reserve Thursday (Feb. 6).
The Devils announced Markstrom is expected to be out of action for 4-6 weeks after suffering a sprained MCL.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Nico Sturm on Injured Reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 22).
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Connor Dewar on Injured Reserve on Saturday (Jan. 25).
The Winnipeg Jets placed F Adam Lowry on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 22).
Schwindt won't accompany the Golden Knights on their upcoming four-game road trip and still on Injured Reserve since Thursday (Jan. 23), as per Jesse Granger of The Athletic.
The Nashville Predators placed F Mark Jankowski on injured reserve on Saturday (Feb. 8).
Poehling did not play in Saturday's (Feb. 8) game against Penguins.
Heineman will not travel to California with the Canadiens for their upcoming three-game road trip and still on Injured Reserve since Wednesday (Jan. 29), as per Renaud Lavoie of TVA Sports.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Noah Gregor on Long Term Injured Reserve Sunday (Feb. 2).
The Blue Jackets announced on Saturday (Jan. 25) that Monahan is expected to be sidelined an additional six to eight weeks due to a wrist injury.
Zary's lower-body injury won't require surgery but he is considered out indefinitely, the Flames reported Friday (Jan. 10).
The Ottawa Senators placed D Jacob Bernard-Docker on Long Term Injured Reserve Sunday (Feb. 2).
HC Rod Brind'Amour said that Carrier has undergone surgery and is facing a long-term absence, according to Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer Friday(Jan. 24).
The Kraken announced on Friday (Jan. 31) that Gourde underwent a sports hernia surgery and is expected to miss an additional 5-7 weeks.

Bortuzzo will participate in practices while traveling with the team, but will miss Saturday's (Feb. 8) clash in Carolina and Sunday's (Feb. 9) tilt in Washington, per Belle Fraser of The Salt Lake Tribune.
Petry will not travel with the Red Wings for their upcoming four-game road trip and still on injured reserve since Wednesday (Jan. 8), according to Ansar Khan of MLive.com.
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Tyson Jost on Long Term Injured Reserve Sunday (Jan. 26).
Lauzon was labeled week-to-week as a result of his lower-body injury and is still on Injured Reserve since Monday (Jan. 6), according to Robby Stanley of NHL.com.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Valeri Nichushkin on Injured Reserve Monday (Feb. 3).
McGinn had surgery to reconstruct his ACL and will be sidelined for 7-9 months, the Ducks announced Tuesday (Jan. 21).
Greenway is slated to begin practicing with the Sabres soon, as per Lance Lysowski of The Buffalo News reports Monday (Jan. 27).
Regula was never taken off the season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday (Dec. 11), per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
The New York Islanders placed G Semyon Varlamov on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 19) and is out indefinetly.
The Dallas Stars placed F Tyler Seguin on Long Term Injure Reserve.
Chinakhov is still a few weeks away from a return, according to Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
The Maple Leafs placed D Jani Hakanpaa on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 31).

The Kraken announced on Wednesday (Jan. 22) that Eberle has resumed workouts and light skating in his recovery from a pelvic surgery but not close to return yet, per Curtis Crabtree of Fox 13 Seattle.
Lindholm is not expected back prior to the 4 Nations Face-Off, as per Fluto Shinzawa of The Athletic reports.
Milano took part in Wednesday's (Jan. 15) practice though he was wearing a non-contact jersey and is still on long-term injured reserve since Wednesday (Nov. 20), per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
Reilly (heart procedure) has been placed on LTIR on Tuesday (Jan. 7). He will be out indefinitely.
The Blue Jackets announced Gudbranson (shoulder) isn't expected to return until the end of March, Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers reports Saturday.

Durzi is traveling with Utah HC for the sake of participating in the team's practices, but he'll still miss Saturday (Feb. 8) and Sunday's (Feb. 9) games in Carolina and Washington, respectively, according to Belle Fraser of The Salt Lake Tribune.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
Jenner (shoulder) is expected to return to the lineup after the 4 Nations Face-Off, Aaron Portzline of The Athletic reports Monday.
Jarnkrok will be re-evaluated in two weeks to determine a clearer recovery timeline, according to David Alter of The Hockey News.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Canadiens said that Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee on Tuesday (Oct. 1) and is out for 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
Couture has not resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 1) and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The Oilers announced that Kane underwent successful knee surgery on Thursday (Jan. 9) and is expected to be sidelined for another 4-8 weeks.

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Hurricanes announced that Fast is out for the 2024-2025 season as he recovers from neck surgery.
GM Kyle Davidson said Monday (Jan. 27) that he's hopeful that Brossoit will be able to return at some point this season, as per Charlie Roumeliotis of WGN Radio.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Thursday (Jan. 2) that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, as per Corey Masisak of The Denver Post.
